texts.index: The mind is not a vessel to be filled but a torch to be set ablaze
texts.research: I am a Computer Science PhD candidate at WPI KorkinLab (Korkin lab) under supervision of Dmitry Korkin. My research is centered around proteomics with an emphasis on network analysis and machine learning. In particular, I am working on application of machine learning models to answer the question how alternative splicing reshapes human interactome. I am looking for postdoc positions in my field and I am open to collaboration.
texts.contact: I welcome collaboration opportunities and I gladly communicate with people. If I may be of assistance feel free to shoot me an email. I am open to any means of communication, from person-to-person meetings, to chats, to video calls.
texts.lab: I am currently commuting spending about 50%/50% time between Boston and Worcester
